intro: Gomidesia fenzliana var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate gomidesia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
